newsitem.title: USA: Montgomery sells fund business to Commerzbank. [CORRECTED 16:50 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Montgomery sells fund business to Commerzbank. [CORRECTED 16:50 GMT]

text.p: Montgomery Securities said Tuesday it sold its Mongtomery Asset Management unit to Commerzbank AG of Germay.
Terms were not disclosed (corrects to make clear Montgomery did not disclose terms).
Montgomery said there would be no change in the fund company's senior management. "They will all be making long-term commitments," a spokeswoman said.
The deal must be approved by the U.S. Federal Reserve.
Montgomery Asset Management has about $8 billion in assets under management. It serves both institutional and retail clients, and has 19 no-load mutual funds.
